quest.name: Down for Maintenance
journal: Despite his better judgment, Jeryk is considering throwing you a bone.
objectives: Deliver the debitage fragments to Urianger.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Piss off.

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: I'd be lying if I said that I didn't expect that. But for what it's worth, I'm sorry.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: Not that it'll do you any good, but we do have a Talos we've been meaning to repair.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: I can show you if you'd like. It'd certainly be nice to hear something other than Magnus's griping for a change.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Thou art come to examine the Talos?

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: Looks like someone's already beat us here, but please─look about as much as you like.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Truly a most vexing state of affairs. I thought mayhap a closer examination might yield something of value...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I see. The means to build Talos stone by stone are lost to us, 'tis true, but here before us slumbers a most fine specimen.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Indeed, were it not for a few minor failings it would be in working condition.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Twill likely require naught but a few modest repairs and a suffusion of aether.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: Well, if you think you can get the thing up and running, far be it from me to stop you. But, what exactly do you reckon is the problem?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I should stress that I have performed only the most cursory of examinations, though such arcane constructs are not wholly unfamiliar to me. As I did suspect from the first, it is host to a network of veins through which aether floweth freely.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Or so it would, were it not for several fractures which now impede said flow.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: How in the hells did you get all that from just a glance? I take it you've thought up a solution as well, then?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: To bridge these fissures requireth a material highly conductive to aether. Once in place, I believe it will be possible to restore the Talos to life.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Might I prevail upon thee to acquire that which we require?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Not far beyond the walls of Twine dwelleth a creature of living stone─the debitage. Full sure am I that stone from such a being would prove most suitable to our needs.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Very good. I shall have Thancred and Minfilia attend me in the remaining preparations.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I spied but three obstructions to the flow of aether in the Talos, and thus would I ask you provide three stones of the debitage. All else will be made ready upon thy return.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Worry not, Forename. Preparations here will be complete ere long.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: Wish we had a mage like him around sooner. As you might imagine, we've had trouble convincing people to come here to help. They either refuse outright or demand payment far beyond anything we could hope to afford.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: It's why we've made such little progress in repairing the Talos. We've pored over every scrap of paper left behind by Daedalus Stoneworks hoping we might learn how it's done, but there just isn't enough.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Thancred and Minfilia will return ere long with the remaining supplies we require.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Didst thou succeed in procuring stone from the debitage?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Fine specimens one and all. You have my thanks. We need now but wait for Thancred and Minfilia's return.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: From end to end, the paths by which aether may flow through the Talos have been duly mended.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: They but require a sufficient enduement.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: It's...not moving.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Strange... The core refuseth to stir. I fear the condition of this Talos is more dire than I previously surmised.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: As a heart driveth blood through a man's veins, so doth the core aether throughout this massive frame. Failing its repair or replacement, the Talos cannot be restored.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: So it was the heart after all...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Thou didst foresee this outcome?

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: Well, no. Not exactly. We'd never gotten this far in trying to repair it, so we had no way of knowing the heart was the real problem.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: We tried to find another. In case things turned out as they are now, but...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: ...Jeryk?

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: This isn't really my story to share.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Please, Jeryk. If something went wrong, maybe we can help.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: All right, all right. After all you lot have done for me, I suppose it's the least I can do.
